subject: oem-ibm: Maintain bootside Mapping and Set bios attribute
commitMessage:
oem-ibm: Maintain bootside Mapping and Set bios attribute

This commit adds code to maintain a mapping between
running, non-running and Temp, Perm side which would
help the bmc and host determine at any point in time if the
code update was successful and that host knows exactly
which side it is running on.

In the event the code update failed, then for that case
the new added bios attribute "hb_boot_side", which will
be set in the event If BMC tries to boot from the new
"Temp" side (other side), and if it fails, then BMC must
update hb_boot_side to "Perm".

Signed-off-by: Sagar Srinivas <sagar.srinivas@ibm.com>
Change-Id: Ied1840f8f9549329db28608410368cc6d0c07bdc

I think we also need to set the bios attribute if the saved version matches the running version? because it could be that the BMC is running from Perm, and a reboot happens, the host would need to to know that the running side is still Perm.
Done

Any reason not to set the bios attribute from the processRenameEvent() function? Seems less error prone if we write the side file and set the bios attribute from the same places, in that way we ensure that if we need to change the side being set we update both the file and the bios attribute.
From the processRename() function we can have "setBootSideBiosAttr(pldmBootSideData.current_boot_side);" like you did above.
I see that in the next commit, there's an effector that can call the processRenameEvent(). Maybe we don't want to set the bios attr in that case and that's why it's here?
Yes, it makes sense to set the bios attribute inside processRenameEvent().
bios attributes help text is used by the customers and is visible via redfish API's, please add more meaningful information regarding what this attribute does.
Done
why was logging headers added ? pldm uses std::cerr, std::couts for logging right ?
Done
why dont you use pldm::utils::dbus::getService() API.
Done

probably this can be removed by using one subtree call to get the service name, i have added subtree pldm utility function as part of https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/pldm/+/42608, please use it and add it to the relation chain.
or we already have pldm::utils::dbus().getService(), which exactly does the same thing.
Done
const reference ?
Done

_current attributes are not meant to be patched via Redfish, can you make this readonly attribute so that readfish cannot patch , but the host can set it.

"readOnly":true 

this would make the attribute readonly.
Ack
const reference ?
Done
Was talking to the host boot team yesterday and realized this. this should be hb_fw_boot_side as per the box notes.
